Badges can require: Mastery + Completion + Capstone

content: Deutsche Sprachlehre für Ausländer
Schulz-Griesbach • Grundstufe 1. Teil
Complete Grading Rubric & Reward Point System
1. Grading Philosophy
This system follows the principle: "Process Earns, Mastery Multiplies."
Students earn steady base points for completing daily work consistently. Bonus multipliers and thematic mastery badges reward demonstrated understanding and long-term retention.

German requires mastery of grammatical cases, noun genders, verb conjugations, and complex sentence structures. The flashcard system includes four specialized card types to address these challenges, with speaking weighted equally to reflect the importance of oral fluency.
2. Course Structure

Deutsche Sprachlehre für Ausländer (Grundstufe 1) contains 15 Abschnitte (Sections), each with parallel Texte (reading passages) and Sprachstoff (grammar material). The course is organized into 5 units of 3 Abschnitte each.

sections.heading: 2.1 Unit Breakdown
tables: Unit Test 1: Foundations (Articles, Present Tense, Nouns, Accusative, Numbers)
Unit Test 2: Building Blocks (Strong Verbs, Prepositions, Dative, Possessives)
Unit Test 3: Intermediate (Modal Verbs, Genitive, Präteritum)
Unit Test 4: Advanced (Perfekt, Reflexives, Position Verbs, Genitive Prep.)
Unit Test 5: Mastery (Adjective Declension, Plusquamperfekt, Subordinate Clauses)

sections.heading: 2.2 Abschnitt Content Overview
content: Each Abschnitt contains two parallel tracks that must both be completed:
3. Per-Abschnitt Components
Each of the 15 Abschnitte includes the following graded components:
4. Grade Weight Distribution
The course grade is calculated from five categories, with speaking elevated to equal status with written work.
tables: In der Schule, Wir lernen Deutsch
Articles, Present tense, sein, Personal pronouns
Haben Sie genug Geld?, Die Zahlen, Die Zeit
Strong verbs, Prefixes, Word order, Prepositions, Negation
Herr und Frau Braun haben Besuch, Unsere Familie
Zwei Studenten in München, Die Mahlzeiten
Prepositions + Dat/Akk, Time adverbs, Word order
Modal verbs, Word order, Personal pronouns, Time
Wohin gehen wir jetzt?, Unser Haus
Das Fernsehen in Heimhausen, Georg als Detektiv
Was hast du heute gemacht?, Freundinnen
Reflexive pronouns, dürfen, Perfekt, Strong verbs
Auf dem Flughafen, Robert und Erich kaufen ein
Genitive prep., Position verbs, hin/her, Indefinites
Adjective decl. with articles, Relative pronouns
Verb forms across tenses and persons

sections.heading: 4.2 Detailed Breakdown
content: Daily Practice — Written (20%)
Texte Exercises: 7% of total grade (accuracy-based)
Sprachstoff Exercises: 8% of total grade (accuracy-based)
Supplementary Worksheet: 5% of total grade (accuracy-based)
Flashcard System (20%)
Flashcard Creation (all 4 types): 8% of total grade
Flashcard Mastery (Box 7): 12% of total grade
Speaking Component (20%)
Daily Read-Aloud: 5% of total grade (completion + self-check)
Abschnitt Conversation Performance: 10% of total grade (rubric-based)
Weekly Speaking Assessment: 5% of total grade (cumulative rubric)
Unit Tests (20%)
Each of the 5 unit tests: 4% of total grade
Cumulative Exams (20%)
Midterm Exam: 8% of total grade
Final Exam: 12% of total grade (includes oral component)
5. Speaking Assessment System
Speaking is assessed through three complementary methods. German pronunciation requires particular attention to umlauts (ä, ö, ü), the 'ch' sounds, and proper stress patterns.

sections.heading: 5.1 Daily Read-Aloud
content: For each Abschnitt, the student:
Records themselves reading the Texte passages and vocabulary lists
Compares their recording to reference audio (native speaker resources)
Self-assesses focusing on: umlauts, 'ch' sounds, word stress, sentence intonation
Parent spot-checks periodically (at least 2× per week)

sections.heading: 5.2 Abschnitt Conversation Performance
content: Each Abschnitt's dialogue from the Texte section is performed orally with a partner (parent, sibling, or recorded). Scored using the Speaking Rubric below.

sections.heading: 5.3 Weekly Speaking Assessment
content: At the end of each week, a cumulative conversation assessment combines material from all Abschnitte covered that week, including grammar structures practiced orally.

sections.heading: 5.4 Speaking Rubric (4-Point Scale)
content: Each speaking performance is scored across four categories. Maximum score = 16 points.
German-Specific Pronunciation Focus:
Umlauts: ä (like 'e' in bed), ö (like 'u' in burn), ü (like 'ew' with rounded lips)
'ch' sounds: ich-Laut (soft, after e/i) vs. ach-Laut (guttural, after a/o/u)
Final consonant devoicing: 'Tag' sounds like 'Tak', 'Hund' sounds like 'Hunt'
Word stress: Usually on first syllable, except for prefixes (be-, ge-, ver-, er-)
6. Reward Point Values
Points are earned for each completed component. These points feed directly into the reward system.

sections.heading: 6.3 Flashcard Mastery Points
content: Each flashcard that reaches Leitner Box 7 earns a one-time graduation bonus, permanently locked once achieved. German uses four card types to address its grammatical complexity.
Note: Vocabulary cards MUST include grammatical gender (der/die/das) to earn full points. Cards without gender marked earn only 5 points.
tables: Grammar Pattern Card (case endings, declension charts)
Sentence Structure Card (word order rules, clause patterns)

sections.heading: 6.4 Assessment Point Values
content: 7. Bonuses & Multipliers

sections.heading: 7.1 Streak Bonuses
content: Completing Abschnitte work on consecutive days earns streak multipliers applied to daily practice points.

sections.heading: 7.4 Milestone Bonuses
content: 8. Thematic Mastery Badges
Each Abschnitt is tagged by linguistic theme. Completing all Abschnitte in a theme AND graduating all associated flashcards to Box 7 earns a Mastery Badge.
tables: Pass Final Exam (70%+ on both written & oral)
Perfect score on Final Oral Exam
Master all 4 German cases (all case cards to Box 7)

sections.heading: 8.1 Badge Categories
tables: All der/die/das vocabulary cards to Box 7
All 4 cases (Nom/Akk/Dat/Gen) pattern cards to Box 7
All conjugation cards (weak + strong verbs) to Box 7
Präsens, Perfekt, Präteritum, Plusquamperfekt cards to Box 7
All sentence structure cards to Box 7
All preposition + case pattern cards to Box 7
All modal verb conjugation cards to Box 7
All adjective declension pattern cards to Box 7

sections.heading: 8.2 Badge Requirements
content: To earn a Mastery Badge (except Conversation Master), a student must:
Complete all Abschnitte containing that theme (Texte + Sprachstoff + worksheet)
Create all flashcards for those Abschnitte
Graduate ALL associated flashcards to Leitner Box 7
Score 80%+ average on unit tests covering those Abschnitte
9. Abschnitt-to-Theme Mapping
Below is the complete mapping of all 15 Abschnitte to their thematic tags. Abschnitte may have multiple tags.

sections.heading: 9.1 Articles & Gender (ART)
content: Abschnitte: 1, 2 (all vocabulary throughout course)
Focus: der/die/das assignment, plural forms, gender patterns

sections.heading: 9.2 Cases (CASE)
content: Abschnitte: 1 (Nom), 2 (Akk), 5 (Dat), 9 (Gen), 11 (Review), 12 (Gen prep)
Focus: Nominative, Accusative, Dative, Genitive case endings and usage

sections.heading: 9.3 Verbs & Conjugation (VERB)
content: Focus: sein, haben, weak verbs, strong verbs, modal verbs, position verbs (legen/liegen, etc.)

sections.heading: 9.4 Tenses (TENSE)
content: Abschnitte: 1 (Präsens), 9 (Präteritum), 10 (Perfekt), 14 (Plusquamperfekt)
Focus: Present, Simple Past (Imperfect), Present Perfect, Past Perfect

sections.heading: 9.5 Word Order (ORDER)
content: Abschnitte: 3, 4, 6, 7, 12, 14
Focus: V2 rule, inversion, subordinate clause word order (verb-final), time-manner-place

sections.heading: 9.6 Prepositions (PREP)
content: Abschnitte: 4, 6, 8, 12
Focus: Accusative prepositions, Dative prepositions, Two-way prepositions (Wechselpräpositionen), Genitive prepositions

sections.heading: 9.7 Modal Verbs (MODAL)
content: Abschnitte: 7, 10
Focus: können, müssen, wollen, sollen, dürfen, mögen/möchten

sections.heading: 9.8 Adjective Declension (ADJ)
content: Abschnitte: 13, 15
Focus: Adjective endings after definite articles, indefinite articles, and without articles

sections.heading: 9.9 Pronouns (PRO)
content: Focus: Personal, Possessive, Demonstrative, Reflexive, Relative, Indefinite pronouns

sections.heading: 9.10 Subordinate Clauses (SUB)
content: Abschnitte: 14, 15
Focus: Nebensätze with weil, dass, ob; Relative clauses (Relativsätze)
10. Maximum Point Totals
The following summarizes the maximum possible points a student can earn in Deutsche Sprachlehre.

sections.heading: 10.2 Weekly Speaking Assessments
content: Assuming ~5 weeks to complete the course:

sections.heading: 10.4 Flashcard Mastery (estimated)
content: Assuming ~25 vocab cards, ~3 grammar pattern cards, ~4 conjugation cards, and ~2 sentence structure cards per Abschnitt:

sections.heading: 10.6 Grand Total
content: Note: This is Grundstufe 1. Teil only. Total points are lower than Spanish/Math due to the shorter course length (15 Abschnitte vs. 45/137 lessons).
11. Grade Scale
The following letter grade scale applies to the weighted course average (not reward points):
12. Implementation Notes

sections.heading: 12.1 Grading Daily Work
content: Both Texte and Sprachstoff exercises must be completed for full credit
Sprachstoff (grammar) exercises weighted slightly higher due to complexity
Perfect scores (100%) earn the accuracy bonus automatically

sections.heading: 12.2 German-Specific Flashcard Rules
content: Vocabulary cards MUST include grammatical gender (der/die/das) — cards without gender earn only half points
Vocabulary cards tested in BOTH directions (German→English and English→German)
Grammar Pattern cards should include full declension tables where applicable
Conjugation cards should include all persons (ich, du, er/sie/es, wir, ihr, sie/Sie)
Sentence Structure cards should include example sentences demonstrating the rule

sections.heading: 12.3 Speaking Assessment — German Focus
content: Special attention to umlaut pronunciation (ä, ö, ü)
Distinguish between ich-Laut and ach-Laut for 'ch' sounds
Practice final consonant devoicing (Tag→Tak, Hund→Hunt)
Emphasize correct word stress patterns

sections.heading: 12.4 Reference Audio Sources
content: dict.cc (free audio for individual words)
Forvo.com (native speaker recordings)
Deutsche Welle (DW) Learn German resources
YouTube: Easy German channel for conversational practice

sections.heading: 12.5 Continuation to Grundstufe 2
content: Upon completion of Grundstufe 1. Teil, students proceed to Grundstufe 2. Teil. Points and badges carry over; a separate grading document will be created for the second volume.
— End of Document —
